# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df)
    df[:ym] = map(dt -> Int(round(year(dt)) * 100 + month(dt)))),
                            df[:dt])
end
```

This function creates a new column `ym` in the DataFrame `df`. It uses the `map` function to apply the conversion to each datetime value in the `dt` column. The result is an integer representing the year and month concatenated as "yyyymm".
